column4: Actually, I think it's more the Intel HDA that's a pain in the arse. ALC889 chipset. It loves playing up, and needing ALSA 1.0.18, and special .conf settins etc =/ Boo/Hiss
Bohne, you'll be lucky to get any optical out of a HDA-Intel. Make sure you have the latest Alsa (1.0.19 as of speaking) - but even then, I doubt it
Bohne, have you tried "auto", "default", "6stack-dig", etc etc to try to find a version that works? You can look up the options avail for HDA-Intel, I just don't know them off the top of my head...
is coax or any other connection known to work?
I have no idea, sorry b0hne --- my HDA-Intel ALC889 works for laptop speakers, and I use this cheap-ass external SB16 with optical/in/out to push stuff to speakers or record
Celebrates Creative's Linux support of their soundcards with a cigarette...
I changed my NAS mounting from sbbfs to cifs today because, apparently, smbfs is depracated... Still works, don't know why I bothered...
Plugged in HDMI the other day to watch an avi on screen - lovely picture, zero sound. Worked first time in Vista. =/
> System | Adminstration | NVIDIA X Server Settings
sorry for delay. so it will be best to check out for a good working soundcard to have my optical device feeded :D btw my ati sound over hdmi didnt even work in vista ;)
